revisions.rev:
'''Sailing at the [[2012 Summer Olympics]]''' in [[London]] is scheduled to be held from 28 July to 11 August in [[Weymouth, Dorset|Weymouth]] and [[Isle of Portland|Portland]]. Ten gold medals will be awarded and 380 athletes expected to take part {{cite web | year = 2009 | url = http://www.london2012.com/sports/olympic/sailing.php| title = Sailing | accessdate = 2009-04-07}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}. The sailing classes have two changes from the [[Sailing at the 2008 Summer Olympics|Beijing 2008]] sailing events. The [[Match race|women's Match Race]] competition replaces the [[Yngling (keelboat)|Yngling]] competition and the [[Tornado (sailboat)|Tornado Class Catamaran]] competition has been dropped. ==Qualification== {{details|Sailing at the 2012 Summer Olympics - Qualification}} 75% of the qualification places will be awarded based on results at the [[2011 ISAF Sailing World Championships]], and the remaining 25% at the World Championships for each boat class. ==Events== A list of the events: {{cite web | year = 2008 | url = http://www.sailing.org/26112.php| title = ISAF Council Decides Equipment For 2012 Olympic Sailing Competition | accessdate = 2009-04-07}} ===Men's events=== {| {{MedalistTable|type=Event}} |- | [[RS:X (sailboard)|Sailboard]]
